name: Low Risk
description: Illnesses that are generally non-threatening and can be treated with minimal medical intervention. These illnesses typically do not pose a serious danger to a person's health.

name: Medium Risk
description: Illnesses that may require medical intervention and can pose moderate danger if not treated. These conditions can impact daily life but are not immediately life-threatening.

name: High Risk
description: Illnesses that can be life-threatening and require urgent medical care. These conditions pose a severe danger to a person's health and can have serious long-term effects.
